questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 8 teacups. If he breaks 3 during his morning tea ceremony, how many teacups does he have left?
questions.explanation: 8 - 3 = 5. Professor Tinkles is quite careful with his remaining teacups!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth needs to measure 4 sides of a square. If each side is 3 paws long, what's the total perimeter?
questions.explanation: 4 sides ร 3 paws = 12 paws. A perfectly measured square, as expected from Sir Whiskersworth!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has 6 algebra books. She buys 4 more at the cat bookstore. How many books does she have now?
questions.explanation: 6 + 4 = 10. Lady Pawsington's library is growing quite nicely!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson found 15 clues in a mathematical mystery. If he solved 9 of them, how many clues remain unsolved?
questions.explanation: 15 - 9 = 6. The Inspector is making excellent progress on this case!

questions.question: If Professor Tinkles serves tea to 3 cats and each cat drinks 2 cups, how many cups of tea are served in total?
questions.explanation: 3 cats ร 2 cups = 6 cups. A proper British tea service for all the feline scholars!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 20 garden tools. If he organizes them into 4 equal groups, how many tools are in each group?
questions.explanation: 20 รท 4 = 5. Sir Whiskersworth has 5 tools in each organized group!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington is solving equations. She has 7 equations solved and 5 more to solve. How many equations does she have in total?
questions.explanation: 7 + 5 = 12. Lady Pawsington has 12 equations in her collection!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 18 tea bags. If he uses 3 tea bags per day, how many days will they last?
questions.explanation: 18 รท 3 = 6. Professor Tinkles' tea bags will last 6 days!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson is investigating 8 cases. If he solves 3 cases, how many cases remain?
questions.explanation: 8 - 3 = 5. Inspector Clawson has 5 cases remaining to solve!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is planting flowers. He has 5 rows with 4 flowers each. How many flowers does he have in total?
questions.explanation: 5 rows ร 4 flowers = 20 flowers. Sir Whiskersworth's garden is blooming beautifully!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has 14 pencils. She gives away 6 pencils to students. How many pencils does she have left?
questions.explanation: 14 - 6 = 8. Lady Pawsington has 8 pencils remaining!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is organizing his study. He has 16 books and wants to arrange them in 2 equal stacks. How many books in each stack?
questions.explanation: 16 รท 2 = 8. Professor Tinkles has 8 books in each stack!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson found 9 clues yesterday and 7 clues today. How many clues has he found in total?
questions.explanation: 9 + 7 = 16. Inspector Clawson has found 16 clues in total!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 24 seeds. If he plants them in 6 equal rows, how many seeds per row?
questions.explanation: 24 รท 6 = 4. Sir Whiskersworth plants 4 seeds in each row!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington is teaching 3 classes with 6 students each. How many students does she teach in total?
questions.explanation: 3 classes ร 6 students = 18 students. Lady Pawsington is a busy teacher!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 9 tea cups and breaks 2 during his morning ceremony. How many cups does he have left?
questions.explanation: 9 - 2 = 7. Professor Tinkles has 7 teacups remaining after the ceremony!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 5 rows of flowers with 4 flowers each. How many flowers does he have in total?
questions.explanation: 5 rows ร 4 flowers = 20 flowers. Sir Whiskersworth's garden is blooming beautifully!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has 21 math books and wants to organize them into 3 equal stacks. How many books per stack?
questions.explanation: 21 รท 3 = 7. Lady Pawsington has 7 books in each organized stack!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson found 8 clues yesterday and 6 clues today. How many clues has he found in total?
questions.explanation: 8 + 6 = 14. Inspector Clawson has found 14 clues in total!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 16 tea bags and uses 4 per day. How many days will they last?
questions.explanation: 16 รท 4 = 4. Professor Tinkles' tea bags will last 4 days!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 7 garden tools and buys 8 more. How many tools does he have now?
questions.explanation: 7 + 8 = 15. Sir Whiskersworth now has 15 tools in his garden shed!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has 24 pencils and gives away 9 to students. How many pencils does she have left?
questions.explanation: 24 - 9 = 15. Lady Pawsington has 15 pencils remaining!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson has 6 cases and each case has 5 clues. How many clues does he have in total?
questions.explanation: 6 cases ร 5 clues = 30 clues. Inspector Clawson has quite a collection of evidence!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 18 tea bags and wants to use 3 per day. How many days will they last?
questions.explanation: 18 รท 3 = 6. Professor Tinkles' tea bags will last 6 days!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 4 flower beds with 6 flowers each. How many flowers does he have in total?
questions.explanation: 4 flower beds ร 6 flowers = 24 flowers. Sir Whiskersworth's garden is flourishing!
